name: ltc.makecode.com
title: ltc.makecode.com - Blocks / Javascript editor for Love-to-code
description: A Blocks / JavaScript code editor for the Love-to-code board.

files.main.blocks: <xml xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1999/xhtml"> <block type="device_forever" id="Aml{F*PTV+ybFOg;WU;t" x="20" y="20"> <statement name="HANDLER"> <block type="device_set_digital_pin_on" id="T_S-r:Pppr3C4dzvJ_gV"> <field name="name">DigitalPin.D1</field> <next> <block type="device_pause" id="u?IEb9NCYtZYPnf/qQ2j"> <value name="pause"> <shadow type="math_number" id="NK9YlbvoCy*Wuz/o/NV."> <field name="NUM">500</field> </shadow> </value> <next> <block type="device_set_digital_pin_off" id="Vo(fBxdrTh-R#r-M60J/"> <field name="name">DigitalPin.D1</field> <next> <block type="device_pause" id="ZPmQL0oLWHHKXqX]po?%"> <value name="pause"> <shadow type="math_number" id="F$-l~`@Y#.0~ec1jhDvu"> <field name="NUM">500</field> </shadow> </value> <next> <block type="variables_set" id="~W$wE#K`IOGUuj92%Y9P"> <field name="VAR">item</field> <value name="VALUE"> <shadow type="math_number"> <field name="NUM">0</field> </shadow> <block type="device_get_digital_pin" id="zOmC5*2!~GSf{3.3iFg;"> <field name="name">DigitalPin.D2</field> </block> </value> <next> <block type="device_set_analog_pin" id="aa.?b_3Gf43@vE`]k-@,"> <field name="name">AnalogPin.A5</field> <value name="value"> <block type="variables_get" id="Jzc4LcGY;!J+BS-8m=X)"> <field name="VAR">item</field> </block> </value> <next> <block type="device_set_analog_pin" id="*h;(+,:~.]*:IOKjtOOp"> <field name="name">AnalogPin.A0</field> <value name="value"> <shadow type="math_number" id="_.$mIYs/d#6~%)/*S!h%"> <field name="NUM">1023</field> </shadow> </value> </block> </next> </block> </next> </block> </next> </block> </next> </block> </next> </block> </next> </block> </statement> </block> </xml>
files.main.ts:
let item = 0
basic.forever(() => {
    pins.digitalWritePinOn(DigitalPin.D1)
    basic.pause(500)
    pins.digitalWritePinOff(DigitalPin.D1)
    basic.pause(500)
    item = pins.digitalReadPin(DigitalPin.D2)
    pins.analogWritePin(AnalogPin.A5, item)
    pins.analogWritePin(AnalogPin.A0, 1023)
})
